comment: Despite Shirov's reputation he doesn't always play the most blood-thirsty unbalanced defenses. 1...d5 weakens e5, but directly aims to prevent White from gaining too much ground with c2-c4 and e2-e4.

Slav Defense -- It' a simple idea: to capture Pc4 and defend it with ...b7-b5. This requires White to pay attention to his weakness (Pc4) . Ideally, for Black, White would have to play e2-e3, blocking Bc1. The downside is that many of it's variations are quite drawish or difficult for Black to win. At the top level of competition it's enough to stop White and perhaps take the opponent away from the kind of game he wanted to play.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 c6 3. Nf3 Nf6
comment: Black hasn't yet moved Pe7, so there's no pin after Bc1-g5. That makes Black's army more mobile. And, the more developed he becomes the more likely ...dxc4 will succeed.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 c6 3. Nf3 Nf6 4. Qc2
comment: This is a poor place for the queen. It weakens Pd4 and could easily become aligned with a ...Bc8-f5.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 c6 3. Nf3 Nf6 4. Qc2 g6 5. cxd5 cxd5 6. Nc3 Bg7 7. Bf4 Nc6 8. e3 O-O 9. Be2
comment: Now White is ready to O-O, so there's little to be gained by maneuvering ...Nc6-b4-c2. With e5 controlled and the king safe White is probably better. Bg7 can't do much except defend Kg8.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 c6 3. Nf3 Nf6 4. Qc2 g6 5. cxd5 cxd5 6. Nc3 Bg7 7. Bf4 Nc6 8. e3 O-O 9. Be2 Ne4 10. O-O Bf5 11. Nh4 Nxc3 12. Qxc3 Be4 13. Nf3
comment: Ivanchuk didn't seem to be in an adventurous mood, but I like that he achieved a draw without the histrionics he sometimes displays.
